: : Darkangel : :

Darkangel: Aye. Follow me, we can take care of this now.

Darkangel leads Tyrael towards the CR room.

Once there, Darkangel raises the platform out of the CR tank so that the unkown bot was suspended apove the tank. Angel then constructs a force field around him so he cant escape.

Darkangel: Wake up.


Nic <Proudwing500k@...> wrote:
Tyrael: He came down without any protective gear? How did he even 
survive the entry?!?

He shuts up for a moment, then realizes something else.

Tyrael: What was a lone bot doing orbiting the planet, then entering 
the atmosphere and surviving? If he wasn't alone, then who was with 
him? I don't like it at all. Take him out of there, we'll interrogate 
him.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : DeathStar/Darkangel : :
> 
> DeathStar: Right away, sir. Flight mode!
> 
> Once again DeathStar flew away from the Tripredacus base, this time 
heading for Maximal territory.
> 
> Darkangel took this time to converse with his superior.
> 
> Darkangel: Not yet. I saw him touch down on my way back. There was 
no ship. Just his exo-structure took him through the atmosphere. 
Somehow he survived. As you could imagine, his injuries are quite 
severe. He'll need extensive CR time.
> 
> 
> Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> Tyrael was surprised.
> 
> Tyrael: Destroyed? The two of them? By the Ancestors, Unicron will 
be 
> so mad! We've got to finish the gun before he comes. Deathstar, go 
> fetch someone from Maximal base to help you and Dreadplague build 
it. 
> Go.
> 
> He thought for a moment, frowning.
> 
> Tyrael: What about your newfound bot, Darkangel? Have you had time 
to 
> analyze him or learn anything about him?
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
wrote:
> > : : Darkangel/DeathStar : :
> > 
> > Darkangel returned to the base with the bot he found. He placed 
the 
> bot in a CR tank. He would check on him in a while.
> > 
> > DeathStar also arrived back at base. Just before landing there 
had 
> been traces of an incoming comm message but the jammers were still 
in 
> place.
> > 
> > Both bots arrive at Tyrael's location.
> > 
> > Darkangel: Darkangel, reporting. The Maximals have defended 
> themselves. Unicron's minions have been destroyed. Rodimus has 
agreed 
> to the alliance. They are preparing. Also, I dound a crashed bot on 
> the way back. He is currently in the CR tank.
> > 
> > DeathStar: The platform for the weapon has been constructed, sir.
> > 
> > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Bloodblade weakly grumbled. What was incredible with him was 
that, 
> > after all the damage he'd taken, he was still not in stasis lock, 
> > simply passed out.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > 
> > > Darkangel finds Bloodblade and decides to take this bot with 
him. 
> > Angel carefully picks up the injured bot and takes off, in bot 
> mode, 
> > for the Tripred base.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > Bloodblade had survived entry, but he was awfully damaged. His 
> > armor 
> > > was charred and stripped away at some places, and molten at 
> others. 
> > > He was in definite need for CR.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> > wrote:
> > > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > > 
> > > > While in flight, returning to the Tripredacus base, Darkangel 
> saw 
> > > Bloodblade come down. He alters course, landing at the touch 
down 
> > > spot, in bot mode.
> > > > 
> > > > Darkangel: That looked like a bot that went down, not a ship. 
> How 
> > > could any being survive the atmospheric entry?
> > > > 
> > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > Bloodblade, orbiting Earth disguised as a pod, got a 
> confirmation 
> > > > that Rockseeker and Lunekill were both terminated. 
Reluctantly, 
> > he 
> > > > decided to warn his Master.
> > > > 
> > > > Bloodblade: Master Unicron, Rockseeeker and Lunekill have 
just 
> > been 
> > > > terminated.
> > > > 
> > > > The response was immediate and terrible. He was attacked both 
> in 
> > > his 
> > > > body and in his spark, even though his Lord was at the other 
> end 
> > of 
> > > > the system. Tendrils of electricity shook him, causing 
> > > interferences 
> > > > that could be picked up from Earth.
> > > > 
> > > > In the middle of his agony, he heard a thundrous voice inside 
> his 
> > > > head.
> > > > 
> > > > Unicron: Incompetent Minions! They have failed me. Now, 
> > Bloodblade, 
> > > > it is your turn to go, but I have learned from this.
> > > > 
> > > > When the pain stopped, he had forgotten who he was or who he 
> > > served. 
> > > > He only remembered his name. He started spinning wildly as he 
> > > entered 
> > > > high orbit and was attracted to the ground.
> > > > 
> > > > A few minutes later, he crashed loudly into the ground, 
exactly 
> > at 
> > > > the same distance from the three bases.
> > > > 
> > > >
